Web Ontology Language
OWL semantics
An OWL ontology comprises:
Entities: the named elements from the knowledge domain, created by the 
ontology creator. Entities are identified using URIs (To work in a web 
setting) 
Axioms: axioms relate the entities to each other using the OWL logic 
vocabulary
An OWL ontology can import other ontologies (owl:import): the 
entities of the imported ontology can be referenced by 
axioms on our ontology
speaker: SYSTEM
